verses.text: Now there was a man of Benjamin, whose name \add was\add* Kish, the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Bechorath, the son of Aphiah, a Benjamite, a mighty \add man\add* of power.

And he had a son, whose name \add was\add* Saul, a choice \add young man\add*, and a goodly: and \add there was\add* not among the children of Israel a goodlier person than he: from his shoulders and upward \add he was\add* higher than any of the people.
And the asses of Kish Saul’s father were lost. And Kish said to Saul his son, Take now one of the servants with thee, and arise, go seek the asses.

And he passed through mount Ephraim, and passed through the land of Shalisha, but they found \add them\add* not: then they passed through the land of Shalim, and \add there they were\add* not: and he passed through the land of the Benjamites, but they found \add them\add* not.

\add And\add* when they were come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant that \add was\add* with him, Come, and let us return; lest my father leave \add caring\add* for the asses, and take thought for us.

And he said unto him, Behold now, \add there is\add* in this city a man of God, and \add he is\add* an honourable man; all that he saith cometh surely to pass: now let us go thither; peradventure he can shew us our way that we should go.

Then said Saul to his servant, But behold, \add if\add* we go, what shall we bring the man? for the bread is spent in our vessels, and \add there is\add* not a present to bring to the man of God: what have we?
And the servant answered Saul again, and said, Behold, I have here at hand the fourth part of a shekel of silver: \add that\add* will I give to the man of God, to tell us our way.
(Beforetime in Israel, when a man went to inquire of God, thus he spake, Come, and let us go to the seer: for \add he that is\add* now \add called\add* a Prophet was beforetime called a Seer.)
Then said Saul to his servant, Well said; come, let us go. So they went unto the city where the man of God \add was\add*.
\add And\add* as they went up the hill to the city, they found young maidens going out to draw water, and said unto them, Is the seer here?
And they answered them, and said, He is; behold, \add he is\add* before you: make haste now, for he came to day to the city; for \add there is\add* a sacrifice of the people to day in the high place:

as soon as ye be come \add into\add* the city, ye shall straightway find him, before he go up to the high place to eat: for the people will not eat until he come, because he doth bless the sacrifice; \add and\add* afterwards they eat that be bidden. Now therefore get you up; for about \add this\add* time ye shall find him.
And they went up \add into\add* the city: \add and\add* when they were come into the city, behold, Samuel came out against them, for to go up \add to\add* the high place.
Now the \sc Lord\sc* had told Samuel in his ear a day before Saul came, saying,

To morrow about \add this\add* time I will send thee a man out of the land of Benjamin, and thou shalt anoint him to be captain over my people Israel, that \add he\add* may save my people out of the hand of the Philistines: for I have looked upon my people, because their cry is come unto me.
And when Samuel saw Saul, the \sc Lord\sc* said unto him, Behold the man whom I spake to thee of: this \add same\add* shall reign over my people.
Then Saul drew near to Samuel in the gate, and said, Tell me, I pray thee, where the seer’s house \add is\add*.

And Samuel answered Saul, and said, I \add am\add* the seer: go up before me \add unto\add* the high place; for ye shall eat with me to day, and to morrow I will let thee go, and will tell thee all that \add is\add* in thine heart.

And as for thine asses that were lost three days ago, set not thy mind on them; for they are found. And on whom \add is\add* all the desire of Israel? \add Is it\add* not on thee, and on all thy father’s house?

And Saul answered and said, \add Am\add* not I a Benjamite, of the smallest of the tribes of Israel? and my family the least of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? wherefore then speakest thou so to me?
And Samuel took Saul and his servant, and brought them into the parlour, and made them sit in the chiefest place among them that were bidden, which \add were\add* about thirty persons.
And Samuel said unto the cook, Bring the portion which I gave thee, of which I said unto thee, Set it by thee.

And the cook took up the shoulder, and \add that\add* which \add was\add* upon it, and set \add it\add* before Saul. And \add Samuel\add* said, Behold that which is left; set \add it\add* before thee, \add and\add* eat: for unto \add this\add* time \add hath it\add* been kept for thee since \add I\add* said, I have invited the people. So Saul did eat with Samuel that day.
And when they were come down from the high place \add into\add* the city, \add Samuel\add* communed with Saul upon the top of the house.

And they arose early: and it came to pass about the spring of the day, that Samuel called Saul to the top of the house, saying, Up, that I may send thee away. And Saul arose, and they went out both of them, he and Samuel, abroad.

\add And\add* as they were going down to the end of the city, Samuel said to Saul, Bid the servant pass on before us, (and he passed on,) but stand thou still a while, that I may shew thee the word of God.
